text: Camaegeria xanthopimplaeformis is a moth of the family Sesiidae. It is known from eastern Madagascar. This species has a wingspan of with a length of the forewings of . The forewings are hyaline with steel-blue reflects and the costal and marginal region blackish and bronze.Viette, 1955. Nouveaux Tineoidea (s.l.) de Madagascar. - Annales de la Société Entomologique de France 123(1954):75–114. Fig.13 It can be distinguished by its yellow body.Bartsch D. & Berg J., 2012. New Species and review of the Afrotropical clearwing moths genus Camaegeria Strand, 1914 (Lep.:Sesiidae: Synanthedonini). - Zootaxa 3181: 28-46 (2012), preview The holotype was collected by A.Seyrig North of Anivorano at the railroad Antananarivo-Toamasina. ==References== Category:Sesiidae Category:Moths described in 1955 Category:Moths of Madagascar Category:Moths of Africa
title: Camaegeria xanthopimplaeformis
